thread.title: Report: Bruins waive Max Talbot, Jeremy Smith | Bruins Insider |
thread.title_full: Report: Bruins waive Max Talbot, Jeremy Smith | Bruins Insider | | Boston Herald

author: Chris Mason
title: Report: Bruins waive Max Talbot, Jeremy Smith | Bruins Insider |
text:
In Bruins training camp, the two most contested positions were backup goaltender and fourth-line winger.
According the TSN's Bob McKenzie, the competitons have ended.
In a surprising move, the B's have reportedly released veteran winger Max Talbot, and netminder Jeremy Smith was also waived.
VAN puts Vey and Corrado on waivers. CGYY puts Paul Byron and Mason Raymond on waivers. BOS puts Max Talbot on.
— Bob McKenzie (@TSNBobMcKenzie) October 5, 2015 TOR did waive Brennan, Campbell, Frattin, Carrick, Froese. NSH waives Jamie Devane, BOS Jeremy Smith, PHI Andrew MacDonald, PIT Tim Erixon.
— Bob McKenzie (@TSNBobMcKenzie) October 5, 2015 Talbot's release signifies that homegrown forward Tyler Randell may have earned a spot in Boston.
Randell is a heavy winger that had an excellent preseason. He was a B's 6th round pick in the 2009 Draft, and led Providence with 120 PIM last season.
Talbot had been acquired by former GM Peter Chiarelli at the trade deadline last season from Colorado for F Jordan Caron and a 6th round pick. He was set to earn $1 million this season.
Smith's release doesn't come as a surprise, as the B's inked his competitor Jonas Gustavsson to a one-year contract yesterday.
